'''gNewSense''' is a [[GNU/Linux distribution]] that uses exclusively [[free software]].<ref name="faq">{{cite web | url = http://www.gnewsense.org/index.php?n=FAQ.FAQ | title = gNewSense Official Website : Free as in freedom {{!}} FAQ / FAQ {{!}} browse | accessdate = 2009-03-17 | work = gNewSense.org}}</ref> gNewSense is based on [[Ubuntu]] and [[Debian]].<ref name="faq"/> It tries to maintain the user-friendliness but with most [[proprietary software|non-free]] software and [[binary blob]]s removed. The [[Free Software Foundation]] considers it to be a free operating system.<ref>http://www.gnu.org/links/links.html#FreeGNULinuxDistributions</ref>
+
'''gNewSense''' is a [[GNU/Linux]] [[operating system]] that uses exclusively [[free software]].<ref name="faq">{{cite web | url = http://www.gnewsense.org/index.php?n=FAQ.FAQ | title = gNewSense Official Website : Free as in freedom {{!}} FAQ / FAQ {{!}} browse | accessdate = 2009-03-17 | work = gNewSense.org}}</ref> gNewSense is based on [[Ubuntu]] and [[Debian]].<ref name="faq"/> It tries to maintain the user-friendliness but with most [[proprietary software|non-free]] software and [[binary blob]]s removed. The [[Free Software Foundation]] considers it to be a free operating system.<ref>http://www.gnu.org/links/links.html#FreeGNULinuxDistributions</ref>
gNewSense takes a relatively strict stance against non-free software. For example, any documentation that gives instructions on installing non-free software is excluded.<ref>[http://wiki.gnewsense.org/Main/CommunityGuidelines]</ref>
gNewSense takes a relatively strict stance against non-free software. For example, any documentation that gives instructions on installing non-free software is excluded.<ref>[http://wiki.gnewsense.org/Main/CommunityGuidelines]</ref>
